page.name: Provide Mastery-Oriented Feedback on Writing
page.content:
Use mastery feedback on writing, whether peer to peer, educator to learner, or learner to educator. Universal Design for Learning (UDL) states that: 

“Mastery-oriented feedback is the type of feedback that guides learners toward mastery rather than a fixed notion of performance or compliance. It also emphasizes the role of effort and practice rather than “intelligence” or inherent “ability” as an important factor in guiding learners toward successful long-term habits and learning practices” (CAST, n.d.).

Mastery-oriented feedback:

  • Encourages perseverance and focuses on development of efficacy and self-awareness
  • Emphasizes effort, improvement, and achieving a standard rather than on relative performance
  • Is frequent, timely, and specific
  • Is substantive and informative rather than comparative or competitive
  • Models how to incorporate evaluation, including identifying patterns of errors and wrong answers, into positive strategies for future success

Additional Resource: UDL checkpoint 8.4
